meanings.definition: Covered in or full of dust.
meanings.sent1: The old attic was much dustier than the rest of the house.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned room was getting dustier every day.
meanings.sent3: The dusty cat sneezed as it explored the even dustier basement.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of childhood were buried in the dustier corners of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The antique book was so dustier that you could write your name on its cover.

meanings.definition: Becoming covered in or full of dust.
meanings.sent1: The neglected furniture looked dustier each time she visited.
meanings.sent2: The forgotten toys in the attic were getting dustier by the minute.
meanings.sent3: The dusty trail became dustier as the wind picked up.
meanings.sent4: His reputation was getting dustier with each passing scandal.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was becoming dustier and dustier, like a forgotten memory.

meanings.definition: To make something covered in or full of dust.
meanings.sent1: She dusted the old shelves, making them even dustier.
meanings.sent2: The wind gusts dustier the furniture in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: He dusted off the ancient artifact, only to make it dustier.
meanings.sent4: The old books were dustier after she attempted to clean them.
meanings.sent5: The careless cleaning only made the room dustier than before.
